model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Okay I made a playlist for our meetup this weekend. It's all punk music, but I have an hour of fun music for the pool and more steady music for our programming studies. It's going to be fun!
That sounds great to me.  Hope I'm able to learn to swim. 
I can teach you! I have taught quite a few people so I'll help you 
I would really appreciate that. Maybe I could go on one of your next cruises.
Yeah, that would be great. I'm excited about going to the Carribean. I've never been. Have you?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Cruise Planning and Excursions', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A talks about planning a cruise to the Caribbeans and the excursions planned, including snorkeling.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: I finished planning my cruise today. It is officially ready to go. ### Speaker B: That is awesome  Where will the cruise be porting? ### Speaker A: in the Caribbeans. I'm pretty excited to go.  ### Speaker B: That does sound fun!  I have always been a bit afraid of cruises because I can't swim.  Are you at all nervous when you go on a cruise? ### Speaker A: I've never been nervous. the boat is pretty big and you could just stay away from the edge if you are afraid of falling over.  ### Speaker B: That's a good point.  What do you enjoy most on cruises?  I have always heard the food is amazing. ### Speaker A: the food is pretty good. they have big buffets. but just the adventure and travel is exciting and so much fun.  ### Speaker B: Do you have an excursion/adventure planned for this cruise? ### Speaker A: we will do some snorkeling and stuff when we get to our destination.  ### Speaker B: If someone can't swim, what other kinds of excursions/adventures would you recommend when at the destination? ### Speaker A: you can go hiking and explore the local area. they have some pretty cool waterfalls. ' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Learning to Swim and Programming', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A offers to teach Speaker B swimming and programming, incorporating punk music and pizzaburgers.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: So maybe you overthought and someday you will learn how to swim? ### Speaker B: Maybe you could teach me. Have you ever been to the carribean before? ### Speaker A: I could teach you! and the Carribean is my next trip. It might help if we put on some punk music before we get in the pool. ### Speaker B: Before during and after! I won't debate you on that. How are you liking this new job? I've always wanted to learn programming. ### Speaker A: It is a bit tedious and repetitive, but rewarding when the job is complete. Swimming helps me relax because it is a bit stressful at times. ### Speaker B: I can imagine. I eat pizzaburgers when Im stressed and I'm stressed a lot. Thats Why I'm thinking I cou;ld learn how to swim now. I'm pretty buoyant if you know what I mean ### Speaker A: haha. Bouyant is a good thing. It will help you float on your back. How about I teach you programming too? For ever hour in water, and hour of training for progrramming? ### Speaker B: And punk music!!! I've always wanteed to eat a pizza burger in a pool\ ### Speaker A: Pizzaburgers, Punk music Programming and some swim time! Its a deal.' }
```
